name: rendezvousing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
rendezvous
to meet someone, especially secretly, at a particular place and time: The police arranged to rendezvous with their informant at a disused warehouse. Only hours before, they had rendezvoused at the Beverly Hills Hotel.
More examplesFewer examplesThey met for one final time in a car park where they had rendezvoused on past occasions. The note explains everything, just in case somehow we can't rendezvous right away.We'll be rendezvousing with the suppliers in less than half an hour.
